title: Here is a list of 20 articles up to 2021 that cover various aspects of dataset annotation aggregation and interpreting multiple expert annotators
Maximum likelihood estimation of observer error-rates using the EM algorithm
container-title: Applied Statistics

title: This foundational paper introduces a method for estimating the error rates of multiple annotators using the Expectation-Maximization (EM) algorithm
Cheap and fast—but is it good? Evaluating non-expert annotations for natural language tasks
container-title: Proceedings of the 2008 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing

title: This paper evaluates the quality of non-expert annotations and discusses methods for aggregating them
Learning from crowds
container-title: Journal of Machine Learning Research

title: The authors propose a probabilistic model for learning from multiple annotators with varying levels of expertise
Get another label? Improving data quality and data mining using multiple, noisy labelers
container-title: Proceedings of the 14th ACM SIGKDD International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining

title: This paper discusses strategies for improving data quality by aggregating labels from multiple annotators
Whose vote should count more: Optimal integration of labels from labelers of unknown expertise
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: The authors present a method for weighting annotators' votes based on their estimated expertise
The multidimensional wisdom of crowds
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: This paper extends the idea of crowd wisdom to multidimensional tasks and proposes a model for aggregating annotations
Quality management on Amazon Mechanical Turk
container-title: Proceedings of the ACM SIGKDD Workshop on Human Computation

title: The authors discuss quality management techniques for crowdsourced annotations on platforms like Amazon Mechanical Turk
Iterative learning for reliable crowdsourcing systems
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: This paper introduces an iterative algorithm for improving the reliability of crowdsourced annotations
Active learning from multiple noisy labelers with varied expertise
container-title: Proceedings of the 2010 IEEE International Conference on Data Mining

title: The authors propose an active learning framework that accounts for the varying expertise of multiple annotators
Variational inference for crowdsourcing
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: This paper presents a variational inference approach for aggregating crowdsourced annotations
Bayesian classifier combination
container-title: Proceedings of the 15th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Statistics

title: The authors propose a Bayesian approach for combining classifiers, which can be applied to aggregating annotations
Learning from the wisdom of crowds by minimax entropy
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: This paper introduces a minimax entropy principle for learning from crowdsourced data
Who said what: Modeling individual labelers improves classification
container-title: Proceedings of the AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: The authors propose a model that accounts for individual annotator behavior to improve classification performance
Comparing Bayesian models of annotation
container-title: Transactions of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: This paper compares different Bayesian models for aggregating annotations from multiple annotators
Deep learning from crowds
container-title: Proceedings of the AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: The authors propose a deep learning approach for learning from crowdsourced annotations
The social impact of natural language processing
container-title: Proceedings of the 54th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: This paper discusses the social implications of NLP, including the importance of high-quality annotations
An ensemble method for crowdsourcing
container-title: Proceedings of the 26th International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: The authors propose an ensemble method for aggregating crowdsourced annotations
Multi-task learning from multiple annotators
container-title: Proceedings of the 28th International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: This paper presents a multi-task learning framework that leverages annotations from multiple annotators
Consistency of the posterior distribution in nonparametric problems
container-title: The Annals of Statistics

title: The authors discuss the consistency of posterior distributions in nonparametric settings, relevant for Bayesian aggregation methods
Active learning with crowdsourcing
container-title: Proceedings of the 2011 Workshop on Crowdsourcing for Search and Data Mining

title: This paper explores active learning techniques in the context of crowdsourced annotations

These articles cover a range of methods and approaches for aggregating annotations from multiple experts and interpreting the results. They include foundational works, recent advancements, and practical applications in various domains
